title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: time profiles residuals task first aims generating time profile plots specified simulation paths. task can account observed data, case residuals calculated plotted. population workflows, aggregation functions used, default mean, median, 5th 95th percentiles computed plotted time profiles.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: Results obtained simulate task stored csv files within subdirectory SimulationResults workflowFolder directory required order perform goodness fit (plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals) task. consequence, workflow output folder include appropriate simulations, task simulate needs active. objects SimulationSet (PopulationSimulationSet population workflows) Output define simulated , available, observed data plotted.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: time profiles residuals task generates simulation set plots : linear logarithmic scale available data total simulated time range.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: simulations multiple applications, 6 time profile plots can generated corresponding simulated time profiles linear logarithmic scale : total simulated time range time range first application time range last application input applicationRanges SimulationSet objects can used select ranges include evaluation.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: observed data available range selected output definition selected dataSelection, added time profile plots. Furthermore, residuals calculated according residual scale defined Output objects included within simulation sets 6 additional plots created figures: Predicted vs observed linear scale Predicted vs observed log scale Residuals vs time Residuals vs simulated output Histogram residuals qq-plot residuals residual scale corresponds one element enum ResidualScales: default uses “Logarithmic” calculate residuals : \(Residuals=log(Observed)-log(Simulated)\) option “Linear” used instead, residuals calculated : \(Residuals=Observed-Simulated\) histogram qq-plot residuals across simulation sets also added end analysis. population workflows, residuals calculated aggregation Simulated output. default, \(median(Simulated)\) used instead \(Simulated\). possible modify aggregation function updating fields object AggregationConfiguration.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: ospsuite.reportingengine package aims facilitating design build reports evaluating PBPK models developed PK-Sim /Mobi. end, package benefits concept R6 classes (similar reference classes) allows define structured objects whose fields can object properties, methods even R6 objects. R6 objects, objects R6 class, presents peculiarities. usually initialized using method $new(...) (e.g. r6Object <- R6Class$new()). Similarly objects class list, fields R6 objects can called using either $fieldName [[fieldName]] (e.g. r6Object$method() r6Object[[property]]). R6 class also integrates concept inheritance: R6 object get attributes class also inherit properties methods parent class.

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: ospsuite.reportingengine package built around two central R6 classes MeanModelWorkflow PopulationWorkflow derived parent R6 class Workflow. creation MeanModelWorkflow PopulationWorkflow objects provides structured environment methods properties facilitate design, run report evaluations PBPK models developed PK-Sim /Mobi. Worklow objects combine 2 features defined R6 objects: SimulationSet PopulationSimulationSet objects defines model(s) /data can used workflow (developed details section 3). objects need created creation workflow objects required create workflow. Task objects define evaluations performed workflow. objects directly created included upon creation Workflow objects (developed details section 4). settings can checked updated creation.

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: Table 1 enumerates main instances ospsuite.reportingengine package usually defined users design workflow. mentioned instances derive R6 class, consequently creating requires call method $new() (e.g. MeanModelWorkflow$new()) comprehensive documentation usage objects accessible tab Reference. Table 1: Nomenclature ospsuite.reportingengine main instances

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: working example workflow script provided reporting time profile plot Minimodel2.pkml. example, list files folders generated workflow : associated report follows:
code: # Get the pkml simulation file: "MiniModel2.pkml" simulationFile <- system.file("extdata", "MiniModel2.pkml",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" )  # Create Output objects which define output paths that will be plotted by the workflow outputA <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|A|Concentration in container",   displayName = "Concentration of A" ) outputB <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|B|Concentration in container",   displayName = "Concentration of B" )  # Create a SimulationSet object which defines the model and outputs to evaluate myExampleSet <- SimulationSet$new(   simulationSetName = "My example",   simulationFile = simulationFile,   outputs = c(outputA, outputB) )  # Create the workflow object myExampleWorkflow <-   MeanModelWorkflow$new(     simulationSets = myExampleSet,     workflowFolder = "myExample-Results"   )  # Set the workflow tasks to be run myExampleWorkflow$activateTasks(c("simulate", "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals"))  # Run the workflow myExampleWorkflow$runWorkflow() list.files(myExampleWorkflow$workflowFolder) #> [1] "log-debug.txt"     "log-info.txt"      "Report-word.md"    #> [4] "Report.docx"       "Report.md"         "SimulationResults" #> [7] "TimeProfiles"

Within Workflow object, simulation sets accessible simulationStructures lists also provides relevant information input/output files folders black frames correspond tasks evaluations performed workflow. tasks defined using Task objects built every Workflow object, meaning need input creating Workflow object. Users access, update switch task /tasks creation Workflow. tasks population workflows perform direct comparison simulation sets (e.g. plotDemography plotPKParameters). comparisons can different according selected population workflow types. Three population workflow types available ospsuite.reportingengine defined PopulationWorkflowTypes: properties (physiology PK Parameter) plotted vs. age weight, time profiles plotted comparison reference population sensitivity analysis done populations except reference population PK parameter plotted parallel Box-Whisker plots without reference population, reference population given, time profiles plotted comparison population sensitivity analysis done populations parallel comparison, PK Parameter additional ratio PK Parameter reference population calculated plotted box-whisker plots Figure 2: Population workflow inputs tasks

what: 2.5. Workflow built in methods and properties
title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: creation Workflow object, built methods properties available (using character $ name object). workflow properties correspond inputs used create workflow includes createWordReport, workflowFolder, reportFileName, list simulationStructures workflow tasks (developed section 4). Additionally, methods listed can used access relevant information workflow: printReportingEngineInfo(): prints information environment pacakges currently used. getWatermark(): prints watermark displayed workflow. getParameterDisplayPaths(): prints mapping parameters display paths getSimulationDescriptor(): prints simulation descriptor used workflow getAllTasks(): prints names workflow available tasks getAllPlotTasks(): prints names workflow plot tasks getActiveTasks(): prints names workflow active tasks getInactiveTasks(): prints names workflow inactive tasks update workflow properties, methods listed can used: setWatermark(watermark): set watermark displayed workflow. input watermark type character. setWorkflowParameterDisplayPaths(parameterDisplayPaths, workflow) setWorkflowParameterDisplayPathsFromFile(fileName, workflow) setSimulationDescriptor(text): set simulation descriptor workflow. input text type character. Finally, method runWorkflow() runs simulations analyses models, also saves evaluations report.

text: dictionary csv file mapping data file. Unlike Matlab version reporting engine, regular csv comma (“,”) separator expected. dictionary file must contain following variables: ‘ID’, ‘type’, ‘datasetColumn’, ‘datasetUnit’, ‘reportName’, ‘pathID’, ‘comment’. time profile plots, must provide ‘time’ ‘dv’ ‘ID’. variable ‘lloq’, lower limit quantitation, can also provided necessary. variables need mapped variable names dataset using dictionary variable ‘nonmenColumn’. Regarding units, two options possible: Providing units using dictionary: ‘time’ ‘dv’ column ‘nonmemUnit’ filled corresponding unit (‘lloq’ assumed unit ‘dv’). dictionary must include follwoing new variables ‘ID’: ‘time_unit’ ‘dv_unit’. dictionary must also include mapping variable names dataset using ‘nonmenColumn’. example shows template dictionary content. title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: illustrated Figures 1 2, workflows perform multiple evaluations tasks list simulation sets. evaluations defined using Task objects built-properties Workflow objects. know tasks workflow can perform, workflow method getAllTasks() can used. Usually, tasks required run workflow, led Task objects include logical field active defining task performed . workflow methods getActiveTasks() getInactiveTasks() provide names active inactive tasks workflow, respectively. modify tasks run, active field task can updated. workflow methods activateTasks(taskNames) inactivateTasks(inactivateTasks) provide fast easy way update tasks run. particular, default value input taskNames getAllTasks(), meaning using activateTasks() without argument activate every task workflow. Additionally, enums StandardSimulationTasks StandardPlotTasks respectively provide quick access standard simulation plot tasks common mean model population workflows. Using example shown section 1.4.. task names mean model workflow : activation/inactivation tasks can done follows:
code: # Names of standard simulation tasks StandardSimulationTasks #> $simulate #> [1] "simulate" #>  #> $calculatePKParameters #> [1] "calculatePKParameters" #>  #> $calculateSensitivity #> [1] "calculateSensitivity"  # Names of standard plot tasks StandardPlotTasks #> $plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals #> [1] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" #>  #> $plotPKParameters #> [1] "plotPKParameters" #>  #> $plotSensitivity #> [1] "plotSensitivity" # All workflow's tasks myExampleWorkflow$getAllTasks() #> [1] "plotSensitivity"              "plotPKParameters"             #> [3] "plotAbsorption"               "plotMassBalance"              #> [5] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" "calculateSensitivity"         #> [7] "calculatePKParameters"        "simulate"  # Only active tasks that are run myExampleWorkflow$getActiveTasks() #> [1] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" "simulate"  # Only inactive tasks that are not run myExampleWorkflow$getInactiveTasks() #> [1] "plotSensitivity"       "plotPKParameters"      "plotAbsorption"        #> [4] "plotMassBalance"       "calculateSensitivity"  "calculatePKParameters" # Inactivate all tasks myExampleWorkflow$inactivateTasks() myExampleWorkflow$getActiveTasks() #> NULL  # Activate only tasks "simulate" and "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" tasks myExampleWorkflow$activateTasks(c("simulate", "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals")) myExampleWorkflow$getActiveTasks() #> [1] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" "simulate"

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances

Among Task properties, field settings includes task properties can updated evaluation, log report workflow. task settings R6 objects whose properties can directly accessed shown (using character $ settings).
code: # Get value of settings property "showProgress" for the task "simulate" myExampleWorkflow$simulate$settings$showProgress #> [1] FALSE  # Get value of settings property "digits" for the task "plotPKParameters" myExampleWorkflow$plotPKParameters$settings$digits #> [1] 2  # Get the names of the "plotConfigurations" list used during the task "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" names(myExampleWorkflow$plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals$settings$plotConfigurations) #> [1] "timeProfile" "obsVsPred"   "resVsPred"   "resVsTime"   "resHisto"    #> [6] "resQQPlot"   "histogram"   "qqPlot"

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: workflow settings defined, workflow method $runWorkflow() run active tasks generate associated results report. following outputs generated workflowFolder directory: logs, results directories reports.

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: Three types logs can generated creation, design run workflow: log-info.txt contains information like starting time version numbers used software log-error.txt contains errors warnings occurred execution log-debug.txt contains information useful debugging purpose.

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: task save results dedicated directory. names results directory follow: SimulationResults contains results simulation runs, obtained simulate task, csv files. possible load results using ospsuite method importResultsFromCSV(). PKAnalysisResults contains results PK analysis runs, obtained calculatePKParameters task, csv files. possible load results using ospsuite method importPKAnalysesFromCSV(). SensitivityResults contains results sensitivity analysis runs, obtained calculateSensitivity task, csv files. possible load results using ospsuite method importSensitivityAnalysisResultsFromCSV(). TimeProfiles contains figures obtained plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals task source values png csv files. PKAnalysis contains figures tables obtained plotPKParameters task source values png csv files. Sensitivity contains figures obtained plotSensitivity task source values png csv files. MassBalance contains figures tables obtained plotMassBalance task source values png csv files. directory specific mean model workflows. Absorption contains figures tables obtained plotAbsorption task source values png csv files. directory specific mean model workflows. Demography contains figures tables obtained plotDemography task source values png csv files. directory specific population model workflows. Default figure format png, possible change default using setPlotFormat().

title: Introduction to Reporting Engine and its instances
text: plot task save appendix file besides results markdown format report. appendices saved directly within workflowFolder directory results directory following names: appendix-time-profile.md plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals task. appendix-pk-parameters.md plotPKParameters task. appendix-sensitivity-analysis.md plotSensitivity task. appendix-mass-balance.md plotMassBalance task. appendix-absorption.md plotAbsorption task. appendix-demography.md plotDemography task. end workflow run, available appendices combined final reports: Report.md contains markdown version report, including table content numbering figures tables. Report-word.md contains markdown version report translated pandoc generating word report. Report.docx contains word version report, including table content numbering figures tables. option createWordReport set TRUE default can set FALSE prevent conversion Report-word.md Report.docx using pandoc .

title: PK parameters
text: PK parameter task aims generating tables , possible, plots requested PK parameters. Depending workflow type, different plots tables can obtained.

title: PK parameters
text: Results obtained calculatePKParameters task stored csv files within subdirectory PKAnalysisResults workflowFolder directory required order perform PK parameters (plotPKParameters) task. consequence, workflow output folder include appropriate simulations, task calculatePKParameters needs active. objects SimulationSet (PopulationSimulationSet population workflows) Output define simulated PK parameters reported.

title: PK parameters
text: mean model workflows, PK parameters task generates directly table PK parameters requested requested Output field pkParameters.

title: PK parameters
text: distribution calculated PK parameters requested output plotted Box Whisker plots along table. default, 5th, 25th, 50th, 75th 95th percentiles plotted. Different types population workflow lead different output: Parallel Comparison: PK parameters plotted parallel Box Whisker plots without reference population. Ratio Comparison: Parallel Comparison additional Box Whisker plots tables ratio PK parameters reference population calculated plotted Box Whisker plots. Pediatric: PK Parameters also plotted range plots PK parameters vs. age weight. Regarding range, task option xParameters can used define demography parameters use x-axis range plots. Parallel ratio use NULL value default, however also possible add range plots Parallel ratio comparison workflow updating value xParameters. Regarding ratio comparison, formula used calculate Box Whisker plot percentile values: \[PK\ Parameter\ Percentile\ Ratio = \frac{PK\ Parameter\ Percentile\ \ Population}{PK\ Parameter\ Percentile\ \ Reference\ Population}\]

title: Plot settings
text: vignette provides guidance define properties settings reporting engine. properties can 2 levels: Global workflow plot configuration, affecting every plot workflow output Local task plot configuration, affecting specific plots within task

what: How to set global workflow properties
title: Plot settings
text: global settings can managed using notion theme tlf package, reporting.engine functions generate plots using tlf package. shortkey methods added reporting.engine package simplify use.

previous_headings: How to set global workflow properties
title: Plot settings
text: theme object R6 class Theme defines default properties used build every plot tlf package. information can found directly within documentation tlf package (vignettes “theme-maker” “plot-configuration”). best workflow set Theme object use json files. Templates json files available tlf package location defined : Modifications theme properties can done directly updating properties Theme object shown : save updated Theme object, function saveThemeToJson provided tlf package can used. addition, tlf package provides Shiny app define save theme clicks: tlf::runThemeMaker(). , important step define Theme object current default workflow. ospsuite.reportingengine, can either achieved using function setDefaultTheme Theme object shown example reTheme. properties defined Theme object used default specific plot configurations provided workflow plots. Caution: loading workflow re-initialize default theme. function setDefaultTheme() needs called initialization workflow. Additionally, Workflow objects theme input argument available method $new() use input theme instead reporting engine default.
code: # Get the path of the Json template jsonFile <- system.file("extdata", "re-theme.json",                          package = "ospsuite.reportingengine")  # Load the theme from the json file reTheme <- tlf::loadThemeFromJson(jsonFile) # Overwrite the current background fill reTheme$background$panel$fill <- "white" reTheme$background$panel$fill #> [1] "white" # Save your updated theme in "my-new-theme.json" tlf::saveThemeToJson("my-new-theme.json", theme = reTheme) # Set reTheme as current default Theme setDefaultTheme(reTheme)

previous_headings: How to set global workflow properties
what: Exporting plots in a specific format
title: Plot settings
text: One important global setting format figure files (e.g. png, jpg pdf) well quality figures. default, figures saved png files size 20 x 15 cm. format settings can managed using function setDefaultPlotFormat() illustrated , input arguments format, width, height, units plot resolution dpi.

previous_headings: How to set global workflow properties
title: Plot settings
text: Watermark corresponds text background plots. Watermark font properties can set Theme object: reTheme$fonts$watermark. Regarding content watermark, default content available Theme object (.e. reTheme$background$watermark example) overwritten Workflow objects: system validated, text printed background default. system validated, text “preliminary results” printed background default. consequence, setting watermark content needs performed directly Workflow objects: either initializing workflow using input argument watermark (e.g. MeanModelWorkflow$new(..., watermark = "vignette example")); using workflow method $setWatermark(watermark) (e.g. myWorkflow$setWatermark("vignette example")). workflow method $getWatermark() prints watermark text background figures output workflow (e.g. myWorkflow$getWatermark()). Note: NULL input argument watermark leads using default watermark feature.

what: How to set task specific properties
title: Plot settings
text: task Workflow objects includes field named settings. optional field class TaskSettings can updated overwrite default behavior task. Two usual subfields settings : plotConfigurations bins. settings can also provided detailed next sections. plotConfigurations list PlotConfiguration objects tlf package. PlotConfiguration R6 class plot properties stored used create plots desired configuration. information can found notion within tlf vignette “plot-configuration”. Providing user-defined PlotConfiguration object input list overwrite default configuration used generate task corresponding task plot(s). bins can number, vector function used bin histograms. next section provide names plots options can accessed field settings.

previous_headings: How to set task specific properties
title: Plot settings
text: Regardless workflow subclass (MeanModelWorkflow PopulationWorkflow), names plotConfigurations list available “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task following: “timeProfile”: time profile plots linear log scale “obsVsPred”: observed vs simulated data linear log scale “resVsPred”: residuals vs simulated data plots “resVsTime”: residuals vs time plots “resHisto”: histograms residuals “resQQPlot”: qq-plots residuals “histogram”: histograms residuals across simulations “qqPlot”: qq-plots residuals across simulations Since histograms performed task, bins can also defined. Displayed names units usually managed SimulationSet Output objects. vignette “goodness--fit” provides details “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task. Example: shows typical mean model workflow example plotConfigurations bins set “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task. next chunk code define PlotConfiguration objects included settings: , settings field “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task can updated shown : run workflow updated settings get resulting report shown . Since histogram across simulations get plot configuration settings defined individual simulations, plots quite different. However, option bins currently set among plots task. Regarding observed vs simulated plots, got updated xlabel, ylabel watermark defined plot configuration.

title: Plot settings
text: Selection, displayed names units usually managed ospsuite PKParameters objects PkParametersInfo objects. vignette “pk-parameters” provides details “plotPKParameters” task. mean model workflows, PK parameters summarized tables. current version, option number decimal numbers set. population workflows, parameters described using plots depends population workflow type. names plotConfigurations list available “plotPKParameters” task following: “boxplotPkParameters”: boxplots PK parameters performed parallel comparison ratio types population workflows “boxplotPkRatios”: boxplots PK parameters ratios performed ratio type population workflows “vpcParameterPlot”: VPC like plots PK parameters vs Demography parameters performed pediatric type population workflows “comparisonVpcPlot”: VPC like plots PK parameters vs Demography parameters comparing reference population performed pediatric type Since pediatric workflows perform VPC like plot, aggregation data performed along demography parameters. binning demography parameters can set optional field bins task field settings. field can either unique value corresponding number bins vector defining bin edges demography parameter paths. Besides, final plot can either link aggregated values plot stairstep. default behaviour perform stairstep plot, can tuned optional field stairstep (TRUE/FALSE) task field settings. shows examples set options:
code: # Associate the bin edges workflowA$plotPKParameters$settings$bins <- c(0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 10)  # Associate the number of bins workflowA$plotPKParameters$settings$bins <- 15  # Set VPC as stair step  workflowA$plotPKParameters$settings$stairstep <- TRUE

title: Plot settings
text: Settings sensitivity plots SensitivityPlotSettings objects. vignette “sensitivity-analysis” provides details “plotSensitivity” task. input argument SensitivityPlotSettings settings object (created using SensitivityPlotSettings$new()): totalSensitivityThreshold: cut-used plots sensitive parameters; default 0.9. variableParameterPaths: paths varied sensitivity analysis. supplied totalSensitivityThreshold 1, else uses default user-provided value. maximalParametersPerSensitivityPlot: maximal number parameters display sensitivity plot. default, maximal number parameters display 50. plotConfiguration: PlotConfiguration object tlf library xAxisFontSize: Font size x-axis labels sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default font size 6. yAxisFontSize: Font size y-axis labels sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default font size 6. xLabel Label x-axis sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default xLabel “Sensitivity”. yLabel Label y-axis sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default yLabel NULL. colorPalette Name color palette used ggplot2::scale_fill_brewer() sensitivity plot. Default color palette “Spectral”. Since displayed sensitivity parameters can include long strings characters shrinking actual plot even using small yAxisFontSize, algorithm providing line breaks included task prevent shrinking issue much possible. Two fields available settings tune algorithm: maxWidthPerParameter maximum width display parameters. Parameters longer line breaks. default maximum width 25 characters. maxLinesPerParameter maximum number lines display parameters. default maximum number lines 3. parameters longer maxLinesPerParameter*maxWidthPerParameter, maxLinesPerParameter setting respected.

title: Qualification Workflow
text: Two simulation tasks available active default qualification workflows: simulate: simulate time profile results requested report plots calculatePKParameters: calculate PK Parameters requested PK DDI ratio plots results stored within workflowFolder output directory, SimulationResults PKAnalysisResults directories respectively. Five plot tasks available qualification workflows, active defined configuration plan: plotTimeProfiles: plot time profiles simulated outputs /observed data. plotGOFMerged: plot goodness fit results grouped simulated outputs vs observed data. plotComparisonTimeProfile: plot comparison time profiles simulated outputs /observed data. plotPKRatio: plot PK ratios simulated vs observed PK parameters function covariate (usually Age). plotDDIRatio: plot Drug-Drug Interaction ratios simulated vs observed PK parameters.

title: Qualification Workflow

Plot tasks can include multiple results report, usually called artifacts. field Artifacts mentioned plot configuration plan, corresponding artifacts results added report.

what: How to update and re-run a qualification workflow
title: Qualification Workflow
text: simulations need re-run, advised relaod workflow using loadQualificationWorkflow. case update require re-run simulations (e.g. updating section content, modifying plot aesthetics removing plot), QualificationWorkflow method $updateConfigurationPlan(configurationPlanFile) can used avoid process reloading checking simulations workflow. , can also inactivate tasks corresponding re-run simulations re-running workflow.
code: # Reload Configuration Plan workflow$updateConfigurationPlan(   configurationPlanFile = newConfigurationPlanFile )  # Inactivate simulations already performed workflow$simulate$inactivate() workflow$calculatePKParameters$inactivate()  # Re-run and build updated report workflow$runWorkflow()

title: Qualification Workflow
text: template R script qualification workflows available can found using function system.file("extdata", "qualification-workflow-template.R", package = "ospsuite.reportingengine"). content file defined .
code: #' @title createQualificationReport #' @description Run a qualification workflow to create a qualification report. #' @param qualificationRunnerFolder Folder where QualificationRunner.exe is located #' @param pkSimPortableFolder Folder where PK-Sim is located. #' If not specified, installation path will be read from the registry (available only in case of full **non-portable** installation). #' This option is **MANDATORY** for the portable version of PK-Sim. #' @param createWordReport Logical defining if a `docx` version of the report should also be created. #' Note that `pandoc` installation is required for this feature #' [https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite.ReportingEngine/wiki/Installing-pandoc] #' @example #' createQualificationReport("C:/Software/QualificationRunner9.1.1") #' createQualificationReport <- function(qualificationRunnerFolder,                                       pkSimPortableFolder = NULL,                                       createWordReport = TRUE) {    #-------- STEP 1: Define workflow settings --------#   #' replace `workingDirectory` and `qualificationPlanName` with your paths   #'   #' The directories are assumed the following structure   #' `workingDirectory`   #'   - `input`   #'     - `qualificationPlanName`   #'   - `re_input`   #'     - `configurationPlanFile`   #'   - `re_output`   #'     - `report`   #'   #' In case your folder structure is different from assumed above,   #' the paths below must be adjusted as well:   #' - `qualificationPlanFile`: path of qualification plan file run by Qualification Runner   #' - `reInputFolder`: input path for the Reporting engine   #' - `reOutputFolder`: outputs of the Reporting Engine will be created here   #' - `reportName`:  path of final report   #'   #' **Template parameters to be replaced below**    #' `workingDirectory`: current directory is used as default working directory   workingDirectory <- getwd()    qualificationPlanName <- "qualification_plan.json"   qualificationPlanFile <- file.path(workingDirectory, "input", qualificationPlanName)    #' The default outputs of qualification runner should be generated under `<workingDirectory>/re_input`   reInputFolder <- file.path(workingDirectory, "re_input")   #' The default outputs or RE should be generated under `<workingDirectory>/re_output`   reOutputFolder <- file.path(workingDirectory, "re_output")    #' Configuration Plan created from the Qualification Plan by the Qualification Runner   configurationPlanName <- "report-configuration-plan"   configurationPlanFile <- file.path(reInputFolder, paste0(configurationPlanName, ".json"))    #' Option to record the time require to run the workflow.   #' The timer will calculate calculation time form internal `Sys.time` function   recordWorkflowTime <- TRUE    #' Set watermark that will appear in all generated plots   #' Default is no watermark. `Label` objects from `tlf` package can be used to specifiy watermark font.   watermark <- ""    #' If not set, report created will be named `report.md` and located in  `reOutputFolder`   reportName <- file.path(reOutputFolder, "report.md")      #----- Optional parameters for the Qualification Runner -----#   #' If not null, `logFile` is passed internally via the `-l` option   logFile <- NULL   #' If not null, `logLevel` is passed internally via the `--logLevel` option   logLevel <- NULL   #' If `overwrite` is set to true, eventual results from the previous run of the QualiRunner/RE will be removed first   overwrite <- TRUE    #-------- STEP 2: Qualification Runner  --------#   #' Start timer to track time if option `recordWorkflowTime` is set to TRUE   if (recordWorkflowTime) {     tic <- as.numeric(Sys.time())   }    #' Start Qualification Runner to generate inputs for the reporting engine   startQualificationRunner(     qualificationRunnerFolder = qualificationRunnerFolder,     qualificationPlanFile = qualificationPlanFile,     outputFolder = reInputFolder,     pkSimPortableFolder = pkSimPortableFolder,     configurationPlanName = configurationPlanName,     overwrite = overwrite,     logFile = logFile,     logLevel = logLevel   )    #' Print timer tracked time if option `recordWorkflowTime` is set to TRUE   if (recordWorkflowTime) {     toc <- as.numeric(Sys.time())     print(paste0("Qualification Runner Duration: ", round((toc - tic) / 60, 1), " minutes"))   }    #-------- STEP 3: Run Qualification Workflow  --------#   #' Load `QualificationWorkflow` object from configuration plan   workflow <- loadQualificationWorkflow(     workflowFolder = reOutputFolder,     configurationPlanFile = configurationPlanFile   )    #' Set the name of the final report   workflow$reportFileName <- reportName   workflow$createWordReport <- createWordReport    #' Set watermark. If set, it will appear in all generated plots   workflow$setWatermark(watermark)    #' Run the `QualificatitonWorklfow` tasklist of ConfigurationPlan   workflow$runWorkflow()    #' Print timer tracked time if option `recordWorkflowTime` is set to TRUE   if (recordWorkflowTime) {     toc <- as.numeric(Sys.time())     print(paste0("Qualification Workflow Total Duration: ", round((toc - tic) / 60, 1), " minutes"))   }   return(invisible()) }

what: Specification of quantities analyzed: model outputs and PK parameters
title: Sensitivity Analysis
text: sensitivity analysis compute variation scalar function time-series trajectory model output response variations model variables. model outputs specified using paths simulated quantities within model. scalar functions PK parameter quantities C_max AUC. Although sensitivity analysis mean model individual within population evaluated PK parameters, user option specifying subset PK parameters sensitivity plots generated. addition, user option set custom display names selected model outputs PK parameters used sensitivity analysis. Sets output PK parameter combinations sensitivity analysis defined follows: , output1 output2 Output objects. path input constructors objects gives path model output. example, path input output1 points concentration caffeine lung interstitial tissue, Organism|Lung|Interstitial|Caffeine|Concentration. model output given display name op1. PK parameters chosen example C_max MRT, given display names new_C_max new_MRT, respectively. Similarly, output2 points model output path Organism|ArterialBlood|Plasma|Caffeine|Concentration. PK parameters selected output2 t_max AUC_tEnd, respective display names new_t_max new_AUC_tEnd used.
code: output1 <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|Lung|Interstitial|Caffeine|Concentration", displayName = "op1",   pkParameters = c(     PkParameterInfo$new("C_max", "new_C_max"),     PkParameterInfo$new("MRT", "new_MRT")   ) ) output2 <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|ArterialBlood|Plasma|Caffeine|Concentration", displayName = "op2",   pkParameters = c(     PkParameterInfo$new("t_max", "new_t_max"),     PkParameterInfo$new("AUC_tEnd", "new_AUC_tEnd")   ) )
